intro: Aphyllocladus denticulatus, commonly known as the toothed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, rounded fruits that contain a single seed. This species is adapted to sandy and rocky soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert habitats.
